channel.title: math.GM updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GM updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Some fixed point theorems in generalized parametric metric spaces and applications to ordinary differential equations
item.description: arXiv:2303.04425v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The objective of this work is the construction of `Boyd-Wong fixed point theorem' in the setting of generalized parametric metric space and discussion its application on existence criteria of solutions to a second order initial value problem. Also an analogue of `Banach type fixed point theorem of generalized parametric metric space is proved and its application on the existence of a solution of first order periodic boundary value differential equation is examined.
item.dc:creator: Abhishikta Das, Hijaz Ahmad, T. Bag

item.title: Disproof of the Riemann Hypothesis
item.description: arXiv:2404.06306v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The Riemann Hypothesis is a conjecture that all non-trivial zeros of Riemann Zeta function are located on the critical line in the complex plane. Hundreds of propositions in function theory and analytic number theory rely on this hypothesis. However, the problem has been unresolved for over a century. Here we show that at least one set of quadruplet-zeros exists outside the critical line through expanding the infinite product of the Riemann Xi zero function. We found that assuming there are no zeros outside the critical line will result in a contradiction with the known result that the reciprocal sum of all zeros of the xi-function is a constant, thereby refuting the Riemann Hypothesis.
item.dc:creator: Dasheng Liu
